item.title: Visual Annotation Platform (VAP)
item.description:
News ğŸ“Œ

  • Schedule ğŸ“…

    • version 0.4.0 is on the schedule.
    • the second-round alpha test will start immediately after the releasement of version 0.4.0.

  • 2022.12.06: the first-round alpha test was finished.

  • 2022.11.27: version 0.3.0 was released.

  • 2022.11.05: version 0.2.0 was released.

  • 2022.11.02: version 0.1.1 was released.

  • 2022.11.01: the Github repository was created (in private).

  • 2022.08.25: the idea of VAP was born.

This project aims to build a Visual Annotation Platform (VAP) for basic computer vision tasks. The current VAP supports image-level, instance-level, and pixel-level annotation, which corresponds to the image classification, object detection, and semantic segmentation task.

This project is based on the postgraduate case-teaching curriculum construction project of Xidian University (XDU-PCTCC), and has been further developed into an independent project.

  • Project Leader: Weiming Chen

  • Programmer: Weiming Chen

  • Language & Library: Python, PySide6

  • Current version: 0.3.0 (click me to download the latest version)

Visit the Github repository for more information (the current repository is private, and it will be publicly available while releasing version 1.0.0):

https://github.com/wmchen97/VisualAnnotationPlatform

Â 

Other Contributors ğŸ¤

  • Bing Han (Prof.): the project leader of the XDU-PCTCC.
  • Ping Wang (Ph.D): a member of the XDU-PCTCC.
  • Yannan Xiong (M.Eng): a participant in the first-round alpha test, who test the pixel-level annotation tool.
  • Yang Zhou (M.Eng): a participant in the first-round alpha test, who test the instance-level annotation tool.
  • Weixiong Zhao (M.Sc): a participant in the first-round alpha test, who test the image-level annotation tool.

Â 

Acknowledgment ğŸ’

item.title: Research on Key Technologies of Adaptive Multi Domain Image Data Automatic Annotation
2021 VIPL-ETRO Remote Sensing Seminar
item.description: We invited Prof. Jonathan Cheung-Wai Chan from Vrije Universiteit Brussel to carry out an online seminar related to the topic of remote sensing.
